page.title: 10PORTHCAWL-Old game revived
page.content: Catty and Doggy is a game played in the mining valleys of Wales during the 1920's.The game is played with 2 wooden sticks (C&D).The doggy is 1m long and 4cm in diameter.This is used to strike the end of the catty,which is a short stick 4cm in diam,15cm long pointed at each end.The object of the game is to hit the catty with the doggy causing the catty to rise in the air,then hitting it as far as possible.You are allowed 3 attempts to hit it.After the 3 attempts the distance is measured with the doggy. Each length of the doggy counts as a run.A team is made of 4-6 players.When one team is batting the other team fields out,as in cricket.
